name: ollam

attributes.attribute: one of the seven levels of poet
prepared to recite all of the 250 important stories of the land
prepared to recite 100 of the lesser tales

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: With regards to the Irish bardic hierarchy, the ollam (alternatively spelled "ollamh" or "ollave") is the highest of the seven levels of Fili or poet. As a person occupying this rank, the ollam was expected to have thorough familiarity with all 250 crucial tales of the country, as well as 100 of the more minor stories.
